issues.description: The UML in the problem statement defines both a `name: String` and an `age: int` attribute on `Animal`, but neither the narrative nor the reference solution use or test the `age` field. This discrepancy will confuse students about whether to include an `age` attribute.
issues.suggested_fix: Remove the `age: int` attribute from the UML diagram (and any instructions), so that `Animal` only has a `name` field, matching the narrative and reference solution.

issues.description: The UML specifies an `Animal(String, int)` constructor, but the reference solution provides only `Animal(String name)`. Students will be unsure whether their `Animal` constructor must accept two parameters.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the UML constructor to a single-parameter signature: change `Animal(String, int)` to `Animal(String name)` so all artifacts match.

issues.description: In the template, the stub for `singFarmSongVerse` is declared without its required `Animal` parameter (`private void singFarmSongVerse(/*Animal animal*/)`), but both the UML and the reference solution expect `singFarmSongVerse(Animal animal)`. Students may not realize they need to add this parameter.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the template method signature to `private void singFarmSongVerse(Animal animal)` so it matches the UML and the reference solution.
